awards.Project Title: Effect of Microgravity on Drug Responses Using Engineered Heart Tissues
awards.Public Health Relevance:
PROJECT NARRATIVE
Understanding the effects of extreme environments such as space travel on human heart tissues is hampered
by the lack of physiologically relevant in vitro models that can mimic clinical conditions from the patient’s own
cells. Patient-derived human induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes self-assembled into
multicellular, three-dimensional structures in a physiologically relevant extracellular matrix offer an excellent
surrogate to recapitulate normal physiology and disease. In this UG3/UH3 proposal, we aim to generate an
ethnically diverse heart tissue array for drug screening in patient groups that manifest severe phenotype after
exposure to microgravity in space.
